Description: Scarab in Egyptian blue, probably mould-made; underside decorated with motif arranged vertically consisting of two addorsed Maat feathers (or just two yod-signs) above a sun-disc; vertical line between both feathers; surface eroded (according to Gardner drawing).
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Gardner (in Gardner 1888, pl. XVIII, no. 41). This Egyptian Blue scarab pertains to a type which was widely distributed in the Mediterranean area, particularly in Italy and Punic sites, and in Southern Russia (Gorton 1996, 109-111, type XXX A, subtype A19-31, see especially A28 for this piece; on the various productions of the "Scarab Factory", see also Webb forthcoming). Gardner, E. A. 1888, Naukratis. Part II (Sixth Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Gorton, A.F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford. Webb, V. forthcoming, Faience finds from Naukratis and their implications for the chronology of the site, in R. Thomas (ed.) forthcoming. Naukratis in Context I: The Nile Delta as a Landscape of Connectivity. Proceedings of the First Naukratis Project Workshop held at The British Museum, 16th –17th December 2011.
Bibliographic references: Gorton 1996 / Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites (p. 110, Type XXX A28)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OE.43) (phase 3)
